publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3493 David Stewart: ParentLine Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates ParentLine Scotland, the national free and confidential helpline for parents and carers, on celebrating its 10th anniversary in 2009 and on receiving more than 85,000 calls since its inception; commends the helpline’s support for parents and carers through highly trained volunteers listening and offering information, support and advice so that parents are better able to cope with issues such as family relationships, child ill-health, bullying and behaviour issues; notes that a significant proportion of calls to ParentLine Scotland are from parents of teenagers, and recognises the particular importance of ParentLine Scotland as a source of easily accessible support for these parents.

S3M-3493 ParentLine Scotland (lodged on 23 February 2009) Bill Butler*, John Park*, David Whitton*, Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mary Scanlon*, Elaine Murray*, Stuart McMillan*, Rhona Brankin*, Sandra White*, Jamie McGrigor*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Paul Martin*, Rob Gibson*, Christina McKelvie*, Jamie Hepburn*, Marlyn Glen*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Claire Baker*, Mary Mulligan*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Trish Godman*, Joe FitzPatrick*, James Kelly*, Brian Adam*
S3M-3493 ParentLine Scotland (lodged on 23 February 2009) Angela Constance*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*, Hugh Henry*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3493 ParentLine Scotland (lodged on 23 February 2009) Alison McInnes*, Ken Macintosh*, Jackie Baillie*

S3M-3493 David Stewart: ParentLine Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates ParentLine Scotland, the national free and confidential helpline for parents and carers, on celebrating its 10th anniversary in 2009 and on receiving more than 85,000 calls since its inception; commends the helpline’s support for parents and carers through highly trained volunteers listening and offering information, support and advice so that parents are better able to cope with issues such as family relationships, child ill-health, bullying and behaviour issues; notes that a significant proportion of calls to ParentLine Scotland are from parents of teenagers, and recognises the particular importance of ParentLine Scotland as a source of easily accessible support for these parents. Supported by: Bill Butler, John Park, David Whitton, Kenneth Gibson, Mr Frank McAveety, Mary Scanlon, Elaine Murray, Stuart McMillan, Rhona Brankin, Sandra White, Jamie McGrigor, Ms Wendy Alexander, Paul Martin, Rob Gibson, Christina McKelvie, Jamie Hepburn, Marlyn Glen, Marilyn Livingstone, Claire Baker, Mary Mulligan, Hugh O’Donnell, Trish Godman, Joe FitzPatrick, James Kelly, Brian Adam, Angela Constance, Bill Kidd, Robin Harper, Hugh Henry, Karen Whitefield, Alison McInnes, Ken Macintosh, Jackie Baillie, Jack McConnell*
S3M-3493 ParentLine Scotland (lodged on 23 February 2009) Christine Grahame*
S3M-3493 ParentLine Scotland (lodged on 23 February 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-3493 ParentLine Scotland (lodged on 23 February 2009) Cathy Peattie*
